\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
Welcome to the Teleport CLF (Causal Logic Framework) Calculator documentation. This system implements a pure mathematical causal minimality calculator for integer\sphinxhyphen{}only file size analysis.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Mathematical Contract}: Single\sphinxhyphen{}seed CLF: C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L) with H=56, CAUS=27, END=5 (locked)

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Decision Rule}: EMIT iff C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) \textless{} 10*L (strict). leb(L) = unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of L (7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups).

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Invariants}: Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only. No compression logic. No floating point. No content scanning. O(log L) only.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\label{\detokenize{index:contents}}
\sphinxstepscope

\subsection{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The CLF Calculator requires Python 3.7+ with no external dependencies for core functionality.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{From Source}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{clone} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{n}{repository}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{url}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}
\PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{Teleport}
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{m} \PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{r} \PYG{n}{requirements}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{txt}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Optional for development tools}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Verify Installation}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}calculator}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{help}
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{CLF\PYGZus{}MAXIMAL\PYGZus{}VALIDATOR\PYGZus{}FINAL}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{help}

\subsection{Basic Usage}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:basic-usage}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Command Line Interface}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Analyze a single file:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}calculator}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{n}{test\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{pic2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{jpg}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Expected output:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
test\PYGZus{}data/pic2.jpg: L=11,751 bytes, bit\PYGZus{}length=14, bounds=2\PYGZca{}13 ≤ L \PYGZlt{} 2\PYGZca{}14,
leb=2, C=104 bits, RAW=117,510 bits, EMIT=True, receipt=a99a8a358d2caac0...
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Analyze multiple files:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Python Library Interface}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{clf\PYGZus{}calculator}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{should\PYGZus{}emit}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{receipt}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Basic calculation}
\PYG{n}{L} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{11751}
\PYG{n}{cost} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Returns 104}
\PYG{n}{decision} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{should\PYGZus{}emit}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}           \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Returns True}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Full receipt}
\PYG{n}{r} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{receipt}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ANALYSIS\PYGZus{}001}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{File size: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{r}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{L}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Cost: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{r}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{cost\PYGZus{}bits}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Decision: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{r}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{emit}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{Understanding Output}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:understanding-output}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Key Fields Explained}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{L}: File size in bytes (the only input parameter)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{bit\_length}: Floor(log\(\sb{\text{2}}\)(L)) + 1, used for bounds display

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{bounds}: Power\sphinxhyphen{}of\sphinxhyphen{}2 bounds showing L’s magnitude

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{leb}: LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of L using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{C}: C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L) causal minimality cost in bits

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{RAW}: 10*L, the raw bit cost for comparison

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{EMIT}: True if C \textless{} RAW (strict inequality)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{receipt}: SHA\sphinxhyphen{}256 hash for calculation verification

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Mathematical Examples}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
L=127    \(\rightarrow\) leb=1 \(\rightarrow\) C=96   \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (96 \PYGZlt{} 1270)
L=128    \(\rightarrow\) leb=2 \(\rightarrow\) C=104  \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (104 \PYGZlt{} 1280)
L=16383  \(\rightarrow\) leb=2 \(\rightarrow\) C=104  \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (104 \PYGZlt{} 163830)
L=16384  \(\rightarrow\) leb=3 \(\rightarrow\) C=112  \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (112 \PYGZlt{} 163840)
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Mathematical Foundation}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:mathematical-foundation}}\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This document provides the complete mathematical foundation for the Teleport CLF (Causal Logic Framework) Calculator.


\subsection{Core Formula}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:core-formula}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The CLF Calculator implements a single\sphinxhyphen{}seed causal minimality formula:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}C_{min}^{(1)}(L) = 88 + 8 \cdot \text{leb}(L)\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Components}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{88}: Fixed overhead comprising H(56) + CAUS(27) + END(5)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{8}: LEB128 bit\sphinxhyphen{}cost multiplier (8 bits per LEB128 byte)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{leb(L)}: Unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of L using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit data groups

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Mathematical Properties}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Domain}: L ∈ ℕ⁺ (positive integers only)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Range}: C ∈ \{88, 96, 104, 112, …\} (discrete 8\sphinxhyphen{}bit increments)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Complexity}: O(log L) computational complexity

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Monotonicity}: Non\sphinxhyphen{}decreasing in L (C(L\(\sb{\text{1}}\)) ≤ C(L\(\sb{\text{2}}\)) for L\(\sb{\text{1}}\) ≤ L\(\sb{\text{2}}\))

\end{itemize}


\subsection{LEB128 Encoding}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:leb128-encoding}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Little Endian Base 128 (LEB128) encoding is central to the cost calculation:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Definition}: leb(L) is the number of bytes required to encode L in unsigned LEB128 format using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit data groups.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Calculation}:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\text{leb}(L) = \begin{cases}
1 & \text{if } 1 \leq L \leq 127 \\
2 & \text{if } 128 \leq L \leq 16383 \\
3 & \text{if } 16384 \leq L \leq 2097151 \\
\vdots & \vdots \\
k & \text{if } 128^{k-1} \leq L < 128^k
\end{cases}\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band Structure}: Files naturally group into “LEB bands” with identical costs:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 1} (L ∈ {[}1, 127{]}): C = 96 bits

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 2} (L ∈ {[}128, 16383{]}): C = 104 bits

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 3} (L ∈ {[}16384, 2097151{]}): C = 112 bits

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band k} (L ∈ {[}128\textasciicircum{}(k\sphinxhyphen{}1), 128\textasciicircum{}k\sphinxhyphen{}1{]}): C = 88 + 8k bits

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Decision Gate}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:decision-gate}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The emission decision follows a strict inequality:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\text{EMIT} \Leftrightarrow C_{min}^{(1)}(L) < 10 \cdot L\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Interpretation}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{EMIT = True}: CLF cost is strictly less than raw bit cost (10L)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{EMIT = False}: CLF cost equals or exceeds raw bit cost

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Efficiency Factor}: When EMIT=True, efficiency = 10L / C

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Critical Boundaries}:

\sphinxAtStartPar
For each LEB band, there exists a threshold L\_critical where the decision changes:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}L_{\text{critical}} = \frac{88 + 8k}{10} = 8.8 + 0.8k\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Since L must be integer and the inequality is strict:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 1}: Always EMIT (96 \textless{} 10L for L ≥ 1)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 2}: Always EMIT (104 \textless{} 10L for L ≥ 128)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band k}: Always EMIT for practical file sizes

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Mathematical Invariants}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:mathematical-invariants}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The CLF Calculator maintains strict mathematical invariants:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Type Invariants}:
\sphinxhyphen{} All calculations use integer arithmetic only
\sphinxhyphen{} No floating\sphinxhyphen{}point operations permitted
\sphinxhyphen{} No approximations or rounding errors

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Consistency Invariants}:
\sphinxhyphen{} Constants locked: H=56, CAUS=27, END=5
\sphinxhyphen{} Formula immutable: C = 88 + 8*leb(L)
\sphinxhyphen{} Decision rule immutable: EMIT iff C \textless{} 10*L (strict)

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Computational Invariants}:
\sphinxhyphen{} O(log L) complexity maintained
\sphinxhyphen{} No dependency on file contents (length\sphinxhyphen{}only)
\sphinxhyphen{} Deterministic results for identical inputs


\subsection{Examples and Edge Cases}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:examples-and-edge-cases}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Standard Cases}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
L=1      \(\rightarrow\) leb=1 \(\rightarrow\) C=96   \(\rightarrow\) RAW=10    \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (9.6× efficiency)
L=127    \(\rightarrow\) leb=1 \(\rightarrow\) C=96   \(\rightarrow\) RAW=1270  \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (13.2× efficiency)
L=128    \(\rightarrow\) leb=2 \(\rightarrow\) C=104  \(\rightarrow\) RAW=1280  \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (12.3× efficiency)
L=16383  \(\rightarrow\) leb=2 \(\rightarrow\) C=104  \(\rightarrow\) RAW=163830 \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (1575× efficiency)
L=16384  \(\rightarrow\) leb=3 \(\rightarrow\) C=112  \(\rightarrow\) RAW=163840 \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (1463× efficiency)
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Large File Cases}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
L=2097151 \(\rightarrow\) leb=3 \(\rightarrow\) C=112  \(\rightarrow\) RAW=20971510 \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (187,246× efficiency)
L=2097152 \(\rightarrow\) leb=4 \(\rightarrow\) C=120  \(\rightarrow\) RAW=20971520 \(\rightarrow\) EMIT=True  (174,762× efficiency)
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Boundary Analysis}:

\sphinxAtStartPar
All practical file sizes result in EMIT=True due to the mathematical structure. The smallest possible efficiency occurs at LEB band boundaries:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 1\(\rightarrow\)2}: L=128, efficiency = 1280/104 ≈ 12.3×

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 2\(\rightarrow\)3}: L=16384, efficiency = 163840/112 ≈ 1463×

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band 3\(\rightarrow\)4}: L=2097152, efficiency = 20971520/120 ≈ 174,762×

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Theoretical Foundation}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:theoretical-foundation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Causal Minimality Principle}: The formula C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) represents the theoretical minimum number of bits required to causally encode size information for a file of length L bytes.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Components Breakdown}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{H=56}: Header information bits

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{CAUS=27}: Causal relationship encoding bits

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{END=5}: Termination marker bits

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{8*leb(L)}: Variable\sphinxhyphen{}length size encoding using LEB128

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Single\sphinxhyphen{}Seed Property}: The “(1)” superscript indicates single\sphinxhyphen{}seed causal encoding, distinguishing from multi\sphinxhyphen{}seed variants.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Asymptotic Behavior}:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\lim_{L \to \infty} \frac{C_{min}^{(1)}(L)}{10 \cdot L} = 0\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This guarantees EMIT=True for all sufficiently large files, with efficiency growing logarithmically with file size.


\subsection{Validation and Verification}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:validation-and-verification}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The mathematical foundation includes comprehensive validation mechanisms:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Theoretical Validation}:
\sphinxhyphen{} Formula derivation from causal minimality principles
\sphinxhyphen{} Proof of O(log L) complexity bounds
\sphinxhyphen{} Analysis of asymptotic behavior

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Computational Validation}:
\sphinxhyphen{} Embedded unit tests covering band boundaries
\sphinxhyphen{} Comprehensive test suite with edge cases
\sphinxhyphen{} pic2\_gate.sh validation script for regression testing

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Empirical Validation}:
\sphinxhyphen{} Testing on real\sphinxhyphen{}world file sizes (pic1.jpg: 63,379 bytes, pic2.jpg: 11,751 bytes, video3.mp4: 9,840,497 bytes)
\sphinxhyphen{} Verification of efficiency claims
\sphinxhyphen{} Cross\sphinxhyphen{}validation between calculator implementations


\subsection{Error Analysis}
\label{\detokenize{mathematical_foundation:error-analysis}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Sources of Error Eliminated}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Floating\sphinxhyphen{}point errors}: Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only arithmetic prevents precision loss

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Implementation drift}: Comprehensive docstrings and guards prevent formula changes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Input validation errors}: Strict type checking and bounds validation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Computational errors}: O(log L) complexity prevents overflow in practical ranges

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Remaining Error Sources}: None identified for the specified domain (positive integer file sizes within system limits).

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Verification Protocol}: The pic2\_gate.sh script provides mathematical verification by cross\sphinxhyphen{}checking results against known correct values and validating all mathematical invariants.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This mathematical foundation ensures the CLF Calculator provides reliable, theoretically grounded, and practically useful causal minimality analysis for file processing decisions.

\sphinxstepscope

Compute single\sphinxhyphen{}seed CLF bound: C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L).


\subsubsection{Contract}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:contract}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses locked constants: H=56, CAUS=27, END=5.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
leb(L) = leb\_len\_u(L) (unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of L).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only. O(log L). No content scanning.

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) in bits.

\sphinxlineitem{rtype}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxhyphen{} Do not vary H/CAUS/END.
\sphinxhyphen{} Do not use leb(8*L) or any alignment/padding adjustments.

\subsection{Usage Patterns}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:usage-patterns}}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\subsection{Implementation Notes}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:implementation-notes}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Performance Characteristics}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
All functions operate in O(log L) time

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Memory usage is O(1) for individual calculations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Batch operations scale linearly with file count

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Thread Safety}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
All functions are pure (no side effects)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Safe for concurrent use across multiple threads

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No shared mutable state

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Numerical Stability}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only arithmetic prevents floating\sphinxhyphen{}point errors

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
All calculations exact within Python’s integer precision

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No rounding or approximation errors

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Validation Built\sphinxhyphen{}in}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Runtime assertions verify mathematical invariants

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Input validation prevents invalid calculations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Receipt hashing enables calculation verification

\end{itemize}

                \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{efficiency}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{r}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{cost\PYGZus{}bits}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{l+s+si}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{.1f}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{x}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{r}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{emit}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{k}{else} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{N/A}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
            \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{jsonify}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
            \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{status}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{success}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{total\PYGZus{}files}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{file\PYGZus{}sizes}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{results}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{results}
        \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{Exception} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n}{e}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{jsonify}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{error}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{e}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{500}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} if \PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{} == \PYGZsq{}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}main\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}\PYGZsq{}:}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}     app.run(debug=True)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
These examples demonstrate the versatility and robustness of the CLF Calculator across different use cases, from simple calculations to complex batch processing and web service integration.

\section{Testing Guide}
\label{\detokenize{testing:testing-guide}}\label{\detokenize{testing::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This guide covers comprehensive testing strategies for the Teleport CLF Calculator, including unit tests, validation procedures, and regression testing.


\subsection{Built\sphinxhyphen{}in Testing}
\label{\detokenize{testing:built-in-testing}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The CLF Calculator includes several layers of built\sphinxhyphen{}in testing:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Self\sphinxhyphen{}Test Mode}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Run the embedded unit tests:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}calculator}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{test}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This executes a comprehensive test suite covering:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
LEB128 band boundaries (127\(\rightarrow\)128, 16383\(\rightarrow\)16384)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Mathematical edge cases

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cost calculation validation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Decision gate verification

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Receipt generation and hashing

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Mathematical Validation Script}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{tools}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{pic2\PYGZus{}gate}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sh}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cross\sphinxhyphen{}checks between multiple calculator implementations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verifies mathematical invariants

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Detects any drift in core calculations

\end{itemize}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test 2: Band consistency}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Testing LEB band consistency...}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{band} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{start} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{128} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{band} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{band} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1} \PYG{k}{else} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{n}{end} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{min}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{128} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{band} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Sample points in band}
        \PYG{n}{sample\PYGZus{}points} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{start}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{start} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{start} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{end}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{/} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{end} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{end}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{n}{costs} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{L} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{sample\PYGZus{}points} \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{L} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{end}\PYG{p}{]}

        \PYG{k}{assert} \PYG{n+nb}{all}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{c} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{expected\PYGZus{}cost} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{c} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{costs}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Band }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{band}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ inconsistent}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\(\checkmark\) Band consistency verified}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\subsection{Best Practices}
\label{\detokenize{testing:best-practices}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Test Development Guidelines}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Pure Functions}: Test mathematical functions in isolation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Deterministic}: All tests must produce identical results on repeated runs

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Comprehensive}: Cover normal cases, edge cases, and error conditions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Fast Execution}: Unit tests should complete in seconds, not minutes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Clear Assertions}: Each assertion should test exactly one property

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Documentation}: Each test should clearly state what it validates

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Continuous Validation}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%

\sphinxAtStartPar
Run tests before any code changes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This testing framework ensures the CLF Calculator remains mathematically accurate, performant, and reliable across all use cases and modifications.

\section{clf\_calculator module}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:clf-calculator-module}}\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!clf\_calculator@\spxentry{clf\_calculator}}\index{clf\_calculator@\spxentry{clf\_calculator}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:module-clf_calculator}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
CLF Single\sphinxhyphen{}Seed Calculator — Pure Causal Minimality (No Compression)


\subsection{Contract}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:contract}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L) bits, where:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
leb(L): unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of integer L using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Locked constants: H=56, CAUS=27, END=5 (non\sphinxhyphen{}negotiable).

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Literal fallback: C\_LIT = 10*L bits.
Decision gate (strict): EMIT ⇔ C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) \textless{} 10*L.


\subsection{Invariants}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:invariants}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only arithmetic. No floating point.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
O(log L) complexity: depends only on leb\_len\_u(L).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Content\sphinxhyphen{}independent: uses file length only (L = os.path.getsize(path)).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No compression/tiling/A/B roles/DP/greedy scans/coverage/bijection.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No variation of H/CAUS/END. No leb(8*L). No align/padding drift.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Receipts}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:receipts}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{For each L, compute a deterministic receipt from the tuple:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
(L, leb, C\_min, RAW, EMIT, BUILD\_ID)

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
using SHA\sphinxhyphen{}256. This enables independent verification.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:usage}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
As CLI: pass file paths; calculator prints one line per file.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
As library: use \sphinxtitleref{clf\_single\_seed\_cost(L)}, \sphinxtitleref{should\_emit(L)}, \sphinxtitleref{receipt(L)}.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Boundaries to test (leb bands)}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:boundaries-to-test-leb-bands}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{L ∈ \{0,1,127,128,16383,16384,…\} to verify leb band transitions:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
leb = ceil(bit\_length(L)/7) if L\textgreater{}0 else 1.

\end{description}
\index{leb\_len\_u() (in module clf\_calculator)@\spxentry{leb\_len\_u()}\spxextra{in module clf\_calculator}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:clf_calculator.leb_len_u}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{clf\_calculator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{leb\_len\_u}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{n}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of integer n using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups.


\subsection{Definition}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:definition}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns 1 if n == 0, else ceil(bit\_length(n) / 7).


\subsection{Pure Integer Contract}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:pure-integer-contract}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only arithmetic; no float or rounding modes.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
O(1) with respect to n’s value (since bit\_length is O(1) on integers).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Independent of file content; depends only on n’s binary magnitude.

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{type n}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{sphinx_autodoc_typehints-type}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}}}

\sphinxlineitem{param n}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Non\sphinxhyphen{}negative integer whose LEB128 encoded byte\sphinxhyphen{}length is desired.

\sphinxlineitem{type n}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\sphinxlineitem{returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The number of bytes required to encode n in unsigned LEB128 (7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups).

\sphinxlineitem{rtype}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\sphinxlineitem{raises AssertionError}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If n \textless{} 0.

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Examples}

\sphinxAtStartPar
leb\_len\_u(0)     \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 1
leb\_len\_u(127)   \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 1   \# 2\textasciicircum{}7 \sphinxhyphen{} 1
leb\_len\_u(128)   \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 2   \# 2\textasciicircum{}7
leb\_len\_u(16383) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 2   \# 2\textasciicircum{}14 \sphinxhyphen{} 1
leb\_len\_u(16384) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 3   \# 2\textasciicircum{}14

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{Contract}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:id1}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
leb(L) = leb\_len\_u(L) (unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of L).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only. O(log L). No content scanning.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxhyphen{} Do not vary H/CAUS/END.
\sphinxhyphen{} Do not use leb(8*L) or any alignment/padding adjustments.

\subsection{Core Functions}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Compute single\sphinxhyphen{}seed CLF bound: C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L).


\subsubsection{Contract}
\label{\detokenize{clf_calculator:id3}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses locked constants: H=56, CAUS=27, END=5.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
leb(L) = leb\_len\_u(L) (unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of L).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only. O(log L). No content scanning.

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{type L}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{sphinx_autodoc_typehints-type}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Forbidden drifts:
\sphinxhyphen{} Do not vary H/CAUS/END.
\sphinxhyphen{} Do not use leb(8*L) or any alignment/padding adjustments.

\end{fulllineitems}

are given.  If x is a number, return x.\_\_int\_\_().  For floating\sphinxhyphen{}point
numbers, this truncates towards zero.

\sphinxAtStartPar

bytes, or bytearray instance representing an integer literal in the
given base.  The literal can be preceded by ‘+’ or ‘\sphinxhyphen{}’ and be surrounded
by whitespace.  The base defaults to 10.  Valid bases are 0 and 2\sphinxhyphen{}36.

\section{clf\_maximal\_validator module}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:module-CLF_MAXIMAL_VALIDATOR_FINAL}}\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:clf-maximal-validator-module}}\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL@\spxentry{CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL}}\index{CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL@\spxentry{CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
CLF Single\sphinxhyphen{}Seed Calculator — Pure Causal Minimality (No Compression)


\subsection{Contract}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:contract}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L) bits, where:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
leb(L): unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of integer L using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Locked constants: H=56, CAUS=27, END=5 (non\sphinxhyphen{}negotiable).

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Literal fallback: C\_LIT = 10*L bits.
Decision gate (strict): EMIT ⇔ C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) \textless{} 10*L.


\subsection{Invariants}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:invariants}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only arithmetic. No floating point.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
O(log L) complexity: depends only on leb\_len\_u(L).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Content\sphinxhyphen{}independent: uses file length only (L = os.path.getsize(path)).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No compression/tiling/A/B roles/DP/greedy scans/coverage/bijection.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No variation of H/CAUS/END. No leb(8*L). No align/padding drift.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Receipts}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:receipts}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{For each L, compute a deterministic receipt from the tuple:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
(L, leb, C\_min, RAW, EMIT, BUILD\_ID)

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
using SHA\sphinxhyphen{}256. This enables independent verification.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:usage}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
As CLI: pass file paths; calculator prints one line per file.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
As library: use \sphinxtitleref{clf\_single\_seed\_cost(L)}, \sphinxtitleref{should\_emit(L)}, \sphinxtitleref{receipt(L)}.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Boundaries to test (leb bands)}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:boundaries-to-test-leb-bands}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{L ∈ \{0,1,127,128,16383,16384,…\} to verify leb band transitions:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
leb = ceil(bit\_length(L)/7) if L\textgreater{}0 else 1.

\end{description}
\index{leb\_len\_u() (in module CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL)@\spxentry{leb\_len\_u()}\spxextra{in module CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:CLF_MAXIMAL_VALIDATOR_FINAL.leb_len_u}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{leb\_len\_u}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{n}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of integer n using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups.


\subsection{Definition}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:definition}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns 1 if n == 0, else ceil(bit\_length(n) / 7).


\subsection{Pure Integer Contract}
\label{\detokenize{clf_maximal_validator:pure-integer-contract}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only arithmetic; no float or rounding modes.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
O(1) with respect to n’s value (since bit\_length is O(1) on integers).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Independent of file content; depends only on n’s binary magnitude.

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{type n}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{sphinx_autodoc_typehints-type}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}}}

\sphinxlineitem{param n}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Non\sphinxhyphen{}negative integer whose LEB128 encoded byte\sphinxhyphen{}length is desired.

\sphinxlineitem{type n}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\sphinxlineitem{returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The number of bytes required to encode n in unsigned LEB128 (7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups).

\sphinxlineitem{rtype}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\sphinxlineitem{raises AssertionError}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If n \textless{} 0.

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Examples}

\sphinxAtStartPar
leb\_len\_u(0)     \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 1
leb\_len\_u(127)   \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 1   \# 2\textasciicircum{}7 \sphinxhyphen{} 1
leb\_len\_u(128)   \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 2   \# 2\textasciicircum{}7
leb\_len\_u(16383) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 2   \# 2\textasciicircum{}14 \sphinxhyphen{} 1
leb\_len\_u(16384) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 3   \# 2\textasciicircum{}14

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{should\_emit() (in module CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL)@\spxentry{should\_emit()}\spxextra{in module CLF\_MAXIMAL\_VALIDATOR\_FINAL}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\section{Docstring Guide Reference}
\label{\detokenize{docstring_guide:docstring-guide-reference}}\label{\detokenize{docstring_guide::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This document provides the complete docstring guide that was applied throughout the Teleport CLF Calculator codebase.


\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{docstring_guide:overview}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The docstring system implements a comprehensive contract\sphinxhyphen{}based documentation approach designed to prevent mathematical drift and ensure long\sphinxhyphen{}term code integrity.


\subsection{Key Principles}
\label{\detokenize{docstring_guide:key-principles}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{DO NOT EDIT Comment Blocks}

\sphinxAtStartPar
All files contain critical \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DO NOT EDIT}} comment blocks that preserve the mathematical contract:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{DO NOT EDIT: This module implements the single\PYGZhy{}seed CLF causal minimality calculator.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{Contract: C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L) with H=56, CAUS=27, END=5 (locked)}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{Decision: EMIT iff C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L) \PYGZlt{} 10*L (strict). leb = unsigned LEB128 byte\PYGZhy{}length.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{Invariants: Integer\PYGZhy{}only. No compression logic. No floating point. O(log L) complexity.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Module Docstring Structure}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Every module follows the Contract/Invariants/Receipts pattern:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{Single\PYGZhy{}seed CLF causal minimality calculator for integer\PYGZhy{}only file size analysis.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{Contract:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Formula: C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L) bits}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Constants: H=56, CAUS=27, END=5 (locked, DO NOT MODIFY)}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Decision: EMIT iff C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L) \PYGZlt{} 10*L (strict inequality)}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{Invariants:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{} Integer\PYGZhy{}only arithmetic (no floating\PYGZhy{}point operations)}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{} O(log L) computational complexity}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{} No file content analysis (length\PYGZhy{}only)}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{} Deterministic results for identical inputs}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{Receipts:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    All calculations generate SHA\PYGZhy{}256 receipts for verification.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Drift detection through comprehensive runtime assertions.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Function Docstring Format}
\label{\detokenize{docstring_guide:function-docstring-format}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Core Mathematical Functions}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Functions implementing core mathematics use detailed specifications:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Calculate single\PYGZhy{}seed CLF causal minimality cost: C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L).}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Args:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        L (int): File size in bytes, must be positive integer}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Returns:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        int: Causal minimality cost in bits}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Mathematical Specification:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8 * leb128\PYGZus{}byte\PYGZus{}length(L)}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        where 88 = H(56) + CAUS(27) + END(5) are locked constants}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Complexity: O(log L)}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Examples:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost(127)    \PYGZsh{} Band 1: leb=1}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        96}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost(128)    \PYGZsh{} Band 2: leb=2}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        104}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost(16384)  \PYGZsh{} Band 3: leb=3}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        112}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Raises:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        ValueError: If L \PYGZlt{}= 0 or L not integer}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Utility Functions}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Utility functions include purpose and relationship to core functions:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{bit\PYGZus{}length\PYGZus{}info}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Purpose:}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Guard Assertions}

\sphinxAtStartPar
All mathematical functions include runtime guards:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}...\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Math guards (DO NOT REMOVE \PYGZhy{} prevent drift)}
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n+nb}{isinstance}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{L} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{ValueError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{L must be positive integer}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Core calculation with locked constants}
    \PYG{n}{leb\PYGZus{}bytes} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{leb128\PYGZus{}byte\PYGZus{}length}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{cost} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{88} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{8} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{leb\PYGZus{}bytes}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} H(56) + CAUS(27) + END(5) + 8*leb}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Post\PYGZhy{}calculation verification}
    \PYG{k}{assert} \PYG{n}{cost} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{88}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Cost }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{cost}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ below minimum}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{k}{assert} \PYG{n+nb}{isinstance}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{cost}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Non\PYGZhy{}integer cost: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{cost}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{cost}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{Implementation Examples}
\label{\detokenize{docstring_guide:implementation-examples}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Correct Docstring Addition}

\sphinxAtStartPar
When adding a new utility function:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{efficiency\PYGZus{}ratio}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Calculate CLF efficiency ratio: 10*L / C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L).}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Args:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        L (int): File size in bytes, must be positive integer}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Returns:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        float: Efficiency ratio (\PYGZgt{}1.0 indicates EMIT=True)}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Relationship to Core CLF:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Uses clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost(L) for C\PYGZus{}min\PYGZca{}(1)(L) calculation.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Provides efficiency context for emission decisions.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Note:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Result interpretation: ratio \PYGZgt{} 1.0 means CLF cost is lower than}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        raw cost, corresponding to EMIT=True decision.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Examples:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} efficiency\PYGZus{}ratio(11751)  \PYGZsh{} pic2.jpg}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        1130.3846...}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Math guards (DO NOT REMOVE)}
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n+nb}{isinstance}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{L} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{ValueError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{L must be positive integer}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{cost} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Core CLF calculation}
    \PYG{n}{raw} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{L}
    \PYG{n}{ratio} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{raw} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{n}{cost}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Verification}
    \PYG{k}{assert} \PYG{n}{ratio} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Invalid ratio: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{ratio}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{ratio}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Incorrect Modifications (PROHIBITED)}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} ❌ PROHIBITED: Modifying constants}
\PYG{n}{H} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{60}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Changed from 56 \PYGZhy{} BREAKS CONTRACT}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} ❌ PROHIBITED: Changing formula}

    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+m+mi}{90} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{leb128\PYGZus{}byte\PYGZus{}length}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Modified formula \PYGZhy{} BREAKS CONTRACT}

\section{Contributing Guide}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:contributing-guide}}\label{\detokenize{contributing::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Welcome to the Teleport CLF Calculator project! This guide provides everything you need to know about contributing to this mathematical analysis tool.


\subsection{Project Overview}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:project-overview}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Teleport CLF Calculator implements a pure mathematical system for causal minimality analysis using the formula:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}C_{min}^{(1)}(L) = 88 + 8 \cdot \text{leb}(L)\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Core Principles:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Mathematical Purity}: Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only arithmetic, no floating\sphinxhyphen{}point operations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Theoretical Grounding}: Based on causal minimality principles

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Performance}: O(log L) computational complexity

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Reliability}: Comprehensive testing and validation frameworks

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Critical Constraints:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Mathematical constants are \sphinxstylestrong{locked}: H=56, CAUS=27, END=5

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Core formula is \sphinxstylestrong{immutable}: C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) = 88 + 8*leb(L)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Decision rule is \sphinxstylestrong{fixed}: EMIT iff C\_min\textasciicircum{}(1)(L) \textless{} 10*L (strict)

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:getting-started}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Prerequisites}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python 3.7 or higher

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Git for version control

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\subsection{Types of Contributions}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:types-of-contributions}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{1. Bug Reports}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Before reporting a bug:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\subsection{Development Guidelines}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:development-guidelines}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Mathematical Integrity}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{CRITICAL: DO NOT MODIFY}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The following elements are mathematically locked:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} LOCKED CONSTANTS \PYGZhy{} DO NOT CHANGE}
\PYG{n}{H} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{56}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Header bits}
\PYG{n}{CAUS} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{27}   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Causal encoding bits}
\PYG{n}{END} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{5}     \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Termination bits}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} LOCKED FORMULA \PYGZhy{} DO NOT CHANGE}
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+m+mi}{88} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{8} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{leb128\PYGZus{}byte\PYGZus{}length}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} LOCKED DECISION RULE \PYGZhy{} DO NOT CHANGE}
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{should\PYGZus{}emit}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{L}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Strict inequality}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Required Practices}
\begin{enumerate}

\item {}

\sphinxstylestrong{Code Style}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Follow established patterns:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{new\PYGZus{}utility\PYGZus{}function}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Brief description of function purpose.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Args:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        L (int): File size in bytes, must be positive integer}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Returns:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        int/bool/str: Description of return value}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Relationship to Core CLF:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Explain how this function relates to core CLF calculations.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Examples:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} new\PYGZus{}utility\PYGZus{}function(11751)}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        expected\PYGZus{}result}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Raises:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        ValueError: If input validation fails}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Math guards (DO NOT REMOVE \PYGZhy{} prevent drift)}
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n+nb}{isinstance}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{L} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{ValueError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{L must be positive integer}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Implementation using core CLF functions}
    \PYG{n}{result} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{some\PYGZus{}calculation\PYGZus{}using\PYGZus{}existing\PYGZus{}functions}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Post\PYGZhy{}calculation verification if needed}

    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{result}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\chapter{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{index:overview}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Teleport CLF Calculator is a pure mathematical system that computes causal minimality bounds for file processing decisions. It operates solely on file lengths using integer arithmetic with strict mathematical guarantees.


\section{Key Features}
\label{\detokenize{index:key-features}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Pure Mathematics}: Integer\sphinxhyphen{}only operations, O(log L) complexity

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Drift\sphinxhyphen{}Proof Design}: Comprehensive docstrings and runtime guards prevent mathematical drift

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Professional Documentation}: Self\sphinxhyphen{}documenting codebase with complete API reference

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Comprehensive Testing}: Full unit test coverage of mathematical boundaries

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Multiple Interfaces}: Command\sphinxhyphen{}line tool and Python library

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Export Capabilities}: Console, JSONL, CSV, and audit formats

\end{itemize}


\section{Mathematical Foundation}
\label{\detokenize{index:mathematical-foundation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The core formula is:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}C_{min}^{(1)}(L) = 88 + 8 \cdot \text{leb}(L)\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Where:
\sphinxhyphen{} L is the file size in bytes
\sphinxhyphen{} leb(L) is the unsigned LEB128 byte\sphinxhyphen{}length of L using 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit groups
\sphinxhyphen{} 88 = H(56) + CAUS(27) + END(5) are locked constants

\sphinxAtStartPar
The decision gate is:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\text{EMIT} \Leftrightarrow C_{min}^{(1)}(L) < 10 \cdot L\end{split}
\end{equation*}

\section{Quick Start}
\label{\detokenize{index:quick-start}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Command Line Usage:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Single file analysis}
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}calculator}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{n}{test\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{pic2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{jpg}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Multiple files with export}
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}calculator}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{n}{file1}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{jpg} \PYG{n}{file2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{mp4} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{export}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{prefix} \PYG{n}{ANALYSIS}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Direct length input}
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}calculator}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{stdin}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{length} \PYG{l+m+mi}{11751}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Library Usage:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{n}{L} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{11751}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} File size in bytes}
\PYG{n}{cost} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{clf\PYGZus{}single\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}cost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Returns 104 bits}
\PYG{n}{emit} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{should\PYGZus{}emit}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{)}               \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Returns True}
\PYG{n}{r} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{receipt}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{L}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{BUILD\PYGZus{}ID}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}          \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Returns full calculation receipt}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
